net.jforum

Class DBConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jforum.DBConnection
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    C3P0PooledConnection, DataSourceConnection, SimpleConnection

    public abstract class DBConnection
extends Object
    Base class for all database connection implementations that may be used with JForum. Default implementations are PooledConnection, which is the defeault connection pool implementation, and SimpleConnection, which opens a new connection on every request.
    Author:
    Rafael Steil

    • Method Detail

      • createInstance

        public static boolean createInstance()
        Creates an instance of some DBConnection implementation.
        Returns:
        true if the instance was successfully created, or false if some exception was thrown.

      • getImplementation

        public static DBConnection getImplementation()
        Gets the current DBConnection implementation's instance
        Returns:
        DBConnection

      • isDatabaseUp

        public boolean isDatabaseUp()
        Checks if database connection is up.
        Returns:
        true if a connection to the database was successfully created, or false if not.

      • init

        public abstract void init()
                   throws Exception
        Inits the implementation. Connection pools may use this method to init the connections from the database, while non-pooled implementation can provide an empty method block if no other initialization is necessary.
        Please note that this method will be called just once, at system startup.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getConnection

        public abstract Connection getConnection()
        Gets a connection. Connection pools' normal behaviour will be to once connection from the pool, while non-pooled implementations will want to go to the database and get the connection in time the method is called.
        Returns:
        Connection

      • releaseConnection

        public abstract void releaseConnection(Connection conn)
        Releases a connection. Connection pools will want to put the connection back to the pool list, while non-pooled implementations should call close() directly in the connection object.
        Parameters:
        conn - The connection to release

      • realReleaseAllConnections

        public abstract void realReleaseAllConnections()
                                        throws Exception
        Close all open connections.
        Throws:
        Exception
